bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Walt Whitman to John Burroughs 13 July 1889
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839-1919, Library of Congress, Washington, DC.

body.p: y'r letter came + is welcome. Hot + oppressive for ten days. but I take it quiet + get along better than you probably suppose. (Cloudy + still + hot to-day)—Sleep + eat fairly—Horace Traubel comes every day—his dinner book with all the speeches + letters will be out in two weeks—I will send it to you. Mrs. O'C says she is left poor./>
